title: Civil Case Schema
description: A schema for a PACER civil court case docket report

docket.description: Ordered array of entries in the case docket

case_id.description: Pacer's case ID, which has the form O:YY-TY-##### (where O is a court office code, YY is a year, TY is the case type, and ##### is a numeric identifier associated with this case)

case_type.description: Abbreviation for the case type ('cv' for civil, 'cr' for criminal, etc)

court.description: The (lowercase) Pacer court abbreviation (e.g. 'ilnd' for Northern District of Illinois)

ucid.description: SCALES's case ID (stands for 'unique case id'), generated by connecting the court abbreviation to the Pacer case ID, delimited by a double semicolon (e.g. 'ilnd;;1:16-cv-00001)

city.description: The city/division within the district where the case appeared; comes from the parenthesis in the header of the docket at the end of the court district (e.g. for 'Northern District of Illinois - CM/ECF LIVE, Ver 6.3.1 (Chicago)', the city is 'Chicago')

header_case_id.description: Similar to case_id, but pulled from the docket itself rather than the filepath; sometimes contains extra information like judge initials and 'All Defendants'

filing_date.description: The date the case was filed - format: MM/DD/YYYY

terminating_date.description: The date the case was terminated - format: MM/DD/YYYY

case_status.description: This will be 'open' if a terminating date is listed, else 'closed'

judge.description: The assigned judge on the case (this is the raw string from the docket header); for criminal cases, this is zeroed out and superseded by defendant-specific judges

referred_judges.description: The referred judges on the case (only present when the case was referred to a second judge); for criminal cases, this is zeroed out and superseded by defendant-specific referred judges

nature_suit.description: The nature of suit for the case (this is matched to the list of known NOS where possible for uniformity of spelling/case, and otherwise left as the raw extracted string)

jury_demand.description: The jury demand specified in the case header

cause.description: The cause specified in the case header

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction of the case (e.g. 'Federal Question')

monetary_demand.description: The monetary demand specified in the case header

lead_case_pacer_id.description: The internal Pacer id of the lead case, when the case is part of multi-district litigation (MDL) or a consolidated case

lead_case_id.description: The case id of the lead case, when the case is part of multi-district litigation (MDL) or a consolidated case

magistrate_case_ids.description: The case ids of any magistrate judge cases (case type 'mj') issuing from this case

related_cases.description: Any case ids listed as 'related cases' in this case's header

other_courts.description: Case IDs provided by Pacer as 'Case in other court'; doesn't pick up all alternate case IDs (e.g. appeals court case numbers)

filed_in_error_text.description: The text line in the header, if any, that indicates this case was erroneously filed ('incorrectly filed,' 'not used,' 'do not docket,' etc)

case_flags.description: The flags in the top right-hand corner of the case docket

appeals_case_ids.description: The case ids of any defendant-specific appeals issuing from this case; for criminal cases, this is zeroed out and superseded by defendant-specific appeals case ids

case_name.description: The title of the case (e.g. 'USA v. Doe')

docket_available.description: True if html docket data is available for this case; False if the source for this case was pre-parsed data (e.g. from Recap)

member_case_key.description: a UCID-formatted version of lead_case_id (if this case is the lead case, this field will match the 'ucid' field)

mdl_code.description: The MDL code that this case is part of, if applicable

mdl_id_source.description: The source that led us to believe this case is part of an MDL

is_mdl.description: Whether or not this case is part of an MDL; this field will be True if an MDL code was found, or if there is a case flag that starts with 'MDL'

is_multi.description: True if this case is part of an MDL, if it has a lead case id, if a list of member cases appears in the header, or if it has appeared in another court

billable_pages.description: The number of billable pages on Pacer for this docket report

cost.description: The cost (in $) of downloading the docket report from Pacer

download_timestamp.description: The time of download of this case from Pacer - format: MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss

n_docket_reports.description: The number of docket reports (HTML) used to generate this JSON; will be 1 if only 1 docket report, or >1 if the case was pieced together from multiple updates (i.e. multiple HTMLs)

source.description: A comma-delimited list of sources for this data, generally 'pacer' or 'recap'

recap_id.description: The Recap id for this case, if applicable

download_url.description: The url on Pacer from which the docket was downloaded

case_pacer_id.description: The unique numerical id that Pacer uses internally to identify this document (pulled from Pacer's XML responses to user queries; not visible on the docket sheet itself)

summary.description: Data from the case summary, if available
